parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>0.50

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Weapons

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns [[true]] if given soldier's weapon is lowered. <br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> important </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> This command will '''always''' return [[false]] if player is sprinting, even without a weapon. Alternatively, the weapon raised state could be obtained via [[animationState]] command <tt>...slow...</tt> vs <tt>...sras...</tt></value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[weaponLowered]] unit

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unit: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Boolean]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>isWeaponLowered = [[weaponLowered]] [[player]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[stance]], [[unitPos]] [[animationState]]
</value></part></template>
<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on November 11, 2016 - 01:13 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Pierre MGI|Pierre MGI]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
This command seems to work for player only, not for AI.
